CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 14, 1946, pg. 16, reads: "Sorry - No Meat, No Barbecue - Charles Long, cook at one of the Hill District's most popular barbecue spots, shrugs his shoulders helplessly at the outcome for barbecue-hungry patrons if the stringent meat shortage does not change.  At this point barbecue is still in existence at most of the restaurants, but with no meat in large quantities expected for the next two months, the outlook is dismal. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Cook Charles Long pointing meat fork into brick oven at barbecue restaurant
